medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports right lower quadrant pain since yesterday evening. The pain was initially mild but migrated to the right lower quadrant earlier today, becoming sharp and continuous, radiating to the right flank. Associated symptoms include nausea and vomiting with one episode of anorexia. The patient denies any fevers, chills, chest pain, shortness of breath, diarrhea, or dysuria. This is her first episode of this type of pain.
